content.p: Imagine that you are buying a bulk package of cookies such as the one shown below.

body.p: There is one big box that is your entire muscle. Inside that box are four smaller boxes that are your fascicles. Inside each of these smaller boxes are four rolls of cookies. Use this analogy to answer the following questions about muscle organization.
The entire package (the muscle) is surrounded by the Outer Box called:

response.feedback: Incorrect. The endomysium surrounds the individual muscle cell.
Correct. The epimysium surrounds the entire muscle.
Incorrect. The perimysium surrounds the fascicle.
Incorrect. This is not a membrane that surrounds the muscle.

question.body: The entire package (the muscle) is then divided into smaller units (the fascicles) that are surrounded by their own boxes called:

response.feedback: Incorrect. The endomysium surrounds the individual muscle cell.
Incorrect. The epimysium surrounds the entire muscle.
Correct. The perimysium surrounds the fascicle.
Incorrect. This is not a membrane that surrounds the muscle.

question.body: The smaller units (the fascicles) are divided into rolls of cookies (individual cell) surrounded by plastic wrap called:

response.feedback: Correct. The endomysium surrounds the individual muscle cell.
Incorrect. The epimysium surrounds the entire muscle.
Incorrect. The perimysium surrounds the fascicle.
Incorrect. This is not a membrane that surrounds the muscle.
